details you should have 12 stitches on each needle setup round place marker for the beginning of the round knit 12 place marker knit to end of the round you should now have a marker at the beginning of the round and at the halfway point the first 12 stitches make up the sole and the remaining stitches 12 make up the instep round 1 * knit 1 m1r knit to 1 before marker m1l knit 1 slip marker repeat from * once more 4 stitches increased round 2 knit all repeat rounds 1 and 2 another 8 more times until you have 60 stitches 30 stitches on each needle foot foot round knit to marker slip marker work chart a repeat foot round until piece measures 1 5 less than the desired foot length from the cast-on edge ending with either round 5 or 10 make note of which round in chart a was worked at the end of the foot heel heel is worked back and forth over the sole stitches which are the first 30 stitches between the markers details on how to do a wrap and turn and how to work wrapped stitches are
